channel.title: .NET on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in .NET on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: dotnet: Announcing Sponsorship on NuGet.org
item.description:
The .NET Blog announces a new Sponsorship feature on NuGet.org designed to help users recognize and support package maintainers and to strengthen the NuGet community.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Microsoft Entra ID token refresh code samples in Python and .NET
item.description:
Microsoft made generally available Python and .NET code samples demonstrating Entra ID token refresh for Azure Database for PostgreSQL to help securely manage authentication tokens when connecting with Entra ID.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: dotnet: Preparing for the .NET 10 GC (DATAS)
item.description:
The .NET 10 Garbage Collector introduces DATAS, a new adaptive mechanism that adjusts heap size automatically. The article explains how DATAS behavior differs from the previous Server GC, and gives guidance on when to tune GC settings or disable DATAS depending on your application’s workload and performance goals.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Developer and AI Code Reviewer: Reviewing AI-Generated Code in .NET
item.description:
Practical guidance for reviewing AI-generated .NET code, emphasizing that AI output should be treated as a starting point and validated through tests, linters, security checks, and clear team processes to maintain quality and productivity.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Introducing Microsoft Agent Framework (Preview): Making AI Agents Simple for Every Developer
item.description:
Microsoft announced the Microsoft Agent Framework (Preview), a unified solution for creating, orchestrating, hosting, and observing AI agents in the .NET ecosystem to help developers ship production AI agents faster.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio — September update
item.description:
The September 2025 GitHub Copilot update for Visual Studio adds new Profiler and .NET Modernization agents, enhances MCP interactions, and introduces smarter code review capabilities to speed debugging, modernization, and developer workflows.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Announcing Aspire 9.5
item.description:
Aspire 9.5 introduces a preview ‘aspire update’ command, single-file AppHost support, improved CLI and dashboard UX, and new integrations for AI, DevTunnels, and other tooling.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: GitHub Copilot app modernization capabilities for Java and .NET are now available
item.description:
Microsoft announced general availability of GitHub Copilot app modernization capabilities for Java and .NET. The offering is designed to reduce redundant, complex work involved in modernizing applications so developers can focus on innovation, while helping ensure apps remain secure, scalable, and up to date.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot app modernization is now generally available for Java and .NET
item.description:
GitHub Copilot app modernization is now generally available for Java and .NET projects. The feature helps teams assess applications, apply automated code transformations, patch builds, and containerize services quickly—reducing modernization work to days.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: dotnet: Prompt Files and Instructions Files Explained
item.description:
A .NET Blog post explaining how GitHub Copilot’s prompt files and instruction files help .NET developers guide and standardize AI-assisted code generation to improve productivity and consistency.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps
item.description:
Application Insights Code Optimizations for .NET Apps helps .NET developers detect performance bottlenecks and receive AI-driven code improvement suggestions via GitHub Copilot integration, streamlining diagnostics and optimizations within the .NET ecosystem.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Performance Improvements in .NET 10
item.description:
A blog post announcing and summarizing hundreds of performance improvements in .NET 10, offering a guided tour of enhancements across the platform to make apps faster, more memory-efficient, and more responsive.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Announcing .NET 10 Release Candidate 1
item.description:
.NET 10 Release Candidate 1 is now available, bringing improvements across the runtime, SDK, libraries, ASP.NET Core, Blazor, .NET MAUI, and more.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: .NET and .NET Framework September 2025 servicing releases updates
item.description:
This is a short recap announcing the September 2025 servicing updates for .NET and .NET Framework. The post summarizes the latest patches and maintenance updates and directs readers to the .NET Blog for full details and download guidance.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: Let Copilot Coding Agent handle the busy work
item.description:
The .NET Blog post demonstrates how the GitHub Copilot Coding Agent automates repetitive developer tasks—like generating unit tests and implementing features from a PRD—using a real .NET sample, enabling developers to concentrate on design and code review.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: dotnet: EFCore.Visualizer – View Entity Framework Core query plan inside Visual Studio
item.description:
EFCore.Visualizer is a Visual Studio extension that lets developers visualize and analyze Entity Framework Core query execution plans directly inside the IDE.

  • Source: .NET

item.title: azure: [In preview] Public Preview: Roslyn Analyzer for Durable Functions in .NET isolated
item.description:
The Roslyn Analyzer for Durable Functions in the .NET isolated model is now available in public preview, providing real-time code analysis to enforce durable orchestration coding constraints.

  • Source: Azure Updates
